alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Orange; Seminole; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Seminole and Orange, northern Brevard, and eastern Volusia Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Port Orange to near Maytown to Sharpes. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. Embedded within this large area of storms, locally gusty winds were occurring. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Titusville and New Smyrna Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
